Silver Fire.name: Silver Fire
Silver Fire.fullText:
Simbarch of Aglarond Attack 11Silver Fire

You summon a jet of pure magical power that burns through all defenses and empowers your other spells.

Encounter        Arcane, Implement
Standard Action      Ranged 20

Target: One creature

Attack: Intelligence +8 vs. Reflex

Hit: 1d6 + Intelligence modifier damage, and until the end of the encounter, each subsequent time you hit the target with an attack, it takes additional damage equal to onehalf your level.


Published in Forgotten Realms Player's Guide, page(s) 62.
Silver Fire.flavor: You summon a jet of pure magical power that burns through all defenses and empowers your other spells.

Ranged 20

Synostodweomer.name: Synostodweomer
Synostodweomer.fullText:
Simbarch of Aglarond Utility 12Synostodweomer

You heal yourself with the ethereal silver fire of pure magic.

Encounter        Arcane, Healing
Minor Action      Ranged 20

Target: You or one ally within 20 squares

Effect: Spend one of your own healing surges but regain no hit points. The target of the spell can then spend a healing surge. (If you are the target, you will have spent two healing surges to regain hit points for one surge.)


Published in Forgotten Realms Player's Guide, page(s) 62.
Synostodweomer.flavor: You heal yourself with the ethereal silver fire of pure magic.

Simbul's Tempest.name: Simbul's Tempest
Simbul's Tempest.fullText:
Simbarch of Aglarond Attack 20Simbul's Tempest

You create a powerful telekinetic storm to pummel your foes. Your arcane wrath transports you in a blaze of silver fire, burning away our mortal frailty.

Daily        Arcane, Force, Implement
Standard Action      Area burst 3 within 20 squares

Target: Each enemy in the burst

Attack: Intelligence vs. Fortitude

Hit: 5d10 force damage. After you finish all attack rolls for this power, for every enemy you hit, you can immediately roll one saving throw against an effect that a save can end. You can roll multiple saving throws against a single effect that a save can end if your first attempts fail.

Miss: Half damage, and you gain no extra saving throws.


Published in Forgotten Realms Player's Guide, page(s) 62.
